data.title: Statement of Accreditation Status
data.meta_site_name: Middle States Commission on Higher Education
data.text:
Eastern University

CEO: Dr. Ronald Matthews, President

Accreditation Liaison Officer: Dr. Christine Mahan

Commission Staff Liaison: Dr. Tiffany Lee, Vice President

Carnegie Classification : Master's Colleges & Universities: Larger Programs » Four-year, small, primarily residential

Control: Private (Non-Profit)

Former Name(s): Eastern College (1/1/2001), Eastern Baptist College (3/1/1972)

Phase: Accredited

Status: Accreditation Reaffirmed

Accreditation Granted: 1954

Last Reaffirmation: 2023

Next Self-Study Evaluation: 2030-2031

Contact Information

1300 Eagle Rd.

St. Davids, PA 19087-3696

(610) 341-5800

www.eastern.edu

Accreditation Actions

Alternative Delivery Methods

Credential Levels

Locations

External Resources

July 1, 2024

To include the reclassification of the additional location at Eastern University-SCI Chester, 500 E. 4th Street, Chester, PA 19013 to a Second Chance Pell Experimental Site. To note that the following program is offered at the location: (1) Associate of Arts (AA) in Liberal Arts. To request a supplemental information report, due April 1, 2025, that provides an update on the specific milestones that demonstrate progress toward developing an approved Prison Education Program (PEP) as provided in the amended Program Participation Agreement (PPA), including: (1) signed written agreement with its correctional facility partner; (2) written evidence of the oversight entity's permission to offer the PEP at the correctional facility; and (3) written documentation of assurances that the oversight entity will provide the best interest determination for the proposed program and provide transfer and release data for students enrolled in the approved program(s) to the institution. To direct a substantive change site visit as soon as practicable but no later than six months after the date of this action. To note that the Commission may rescind this action if the substantive change is not implemented or the institution's participation in the experiment is terminated by the United States Department of Education (USDE). The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2030-2031.

April 25, 2024

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To note the institution's decision to close the additional location at 1601 Market Street, Philadelphia, PA 19103 that ceased operations effective June 30, 2023. To remove the additional location from the institution's scope of accreditation. To note that the Commission reserves the right to rescind this action if any developments reveal additional information that might have affected the Commission's decision. The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2030-2031.

March 28, 2024

Staff acted on behalf of the Commission to acknowledge receipt of the supplemental information report requested by the Commission action of November 6, 2023, providing information on key data indicators (enrollment – FTE), as reported on the 2023 Annual Institutional Update (AIU) in accordance with federal regulation 34 CFR § 602.19(d). The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2030-2031.

January 4, 2024

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To note the institution's decision to close the additional location at 420 Delaware Drive, Fort Washington, PA, 19034 that ceased operations effective December 13, 2020. To remove the additional location from the institution's scope of accreditation. To note that the Commission reserves the right to rescind this action if any developments reveal additional information that might have affected the Commission's decision. The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2030-2031.

January 4, 2024

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To note the institution's decision to close the additional location at 4201 Crums Mill Road, Harrisburg, PA 17111 that ceased operations effective November 30, 2023. To remove the additional location from the institution's scope of accreditation. To note that the Commission reserves the right to rescind this action if any developments reveal additional information that might have affected the Commission's decision.

November 6, 2023

Staff acted on behalf of the Commission to request a supplemental information report, due December 13, 2023, providing information on key data indicators (enrollment – FTE) as reported on the 2023 Annual Institutional Update in accordance with federal regulation 34 CFR § 602.19 (d). The next evaluation date is scheduled for 2030-2031.

June 22, 2023

To acknowledge receipt of the self-study report. To note the on-site evaluation visit by the Commission's representatives to the main campus at 1300 Eagle Rd, St. Davids, PA 19087 on March 26-29, 2023. To note the following branch campus was visited: 4261 North 5th Street, Philadelphia, PA 19140. To note the following additional locations were visited: (1) 4201 Crums Mill Road, Harrisburg, PA 17112 and (2) 1 Winding Drive, Philadelphia, PA 19131. To reaffirm accreditation. To note that Recommendation Responses in conjunction with the Annual Institutional Update (AIU) are no longer required. The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2030-2031.

August 27, 2020

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To include the reclassification of the other instructional site at 500 E. 4th Street, Chester, PA 19013 to an additional location within the institution's scope of accreditation. To require immediate notification when the change is implemented. To note that the Commission reserves the right to rescind approval of this substantive change if any developments reveal additional information that might have affected the Commission's decision and/or the requested substantive change is not implemented within one calendar year from the date of this action. The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2022-2023.

March 5, 2020

To note that the Mid-Point Peer Review has been conducted. To request that, beginning in 2020 and in conjunction with each Annual Institutional Update prior to the self-study visit in 2022-2023, the institution provide further evidence of (1) enrollment management planning linked to budget development (Standard VI) and (2) strategies to address enrollment decline (Standard VI).

February 27, 2020

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To note the institution's decision to close the additional location at Manor College, 700 Fox Chase Road, Jenkintown, PA 19046. To require immediate notification when instruction ceases at the additional location. To note that the Commission may rescind this action if the requested substantive change is not implemented within one calendar year from the date of this action. The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2022-2023.

October 29, 2019

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To include the relocation of the ACTS Retirement - Life Community, Inc. additional location at 812 North Bethlehem Pike, Ambler, PA 19002 to ARLC Fort Washington, 420 Delaware Drive, Ft. Washington, PA 19034 within the institution's scope of accreditation. To require immediate notification when instruction commences at the new location and of the date that instruction ceases at the former location. To note the Commission may rescind this action if instruction at this location does not commence within one calendar year from the date of this action. The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2022-2023.

July 2, 2019

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To include the relocation of the Eastern University/Philadelphia additional location from 3300 Henry Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19129 to Eastern University/City Avenue, 1 Winding Drive, Philadelphia, PA 19131 within the institution's scope of accreditation. To require immediate notification when instruction commences at the new location and of the date that instruction ceases at the former location. To note the Commission may rescind this action if instruction at this location does not commence within one calendar year from the date of this action. The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2022-2023.

April 30, 2019

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To note the institution's decision to close the additional location at Eastern University/Philadelphia at People for People, Inc., 700-800 Broad Street, Philadelphia, PA 19130. To require immediate notification when instruction ceases at the additional location. To note the Commission may rescind this action if the requested substantive change is not implemented within one calendar year from the date of this action.

April 30, 2019

To acknowledge receipt of the teach-out plan. To approve the teach-out plan. To note that the institution will conduct and complete its own teach-out by May 31, 2019 and that teach-out agreements are not required. The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2022-2023.

January 4, 2019

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To include the relocation of the additional location from Central PA Office of SPS, 750 East Park Drive, Harrisburg, PA 17111-2758 to Eastern University Harrisburg, 4201 Crums Hill Road, Harrisburg, PA 17112 within the scope of the institution's accreditation. The Commission requires notification within thirty days of the commencement of operations at the new location and the closure of the old location. Operations at the location must commence within one calendar year from the date of this action. The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2022-2023.

February 22, 2018

To rescind the substantive change action of October 31, 2016. To note the institution's decision to not operate at the site at Eastern University-Central PA, 10 North Second Street, Harrisburg, PA 17101 and to remain at the additional location at Central PA Office of SPS, 750 East Park Drive, Harrisburg, PA 17111-2758.

May 1, 2017

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To include the additional location at Manor College, 700 Fox Chase Road, Jenkintown, PA 19046 within the scope of the institution's accreditation. The Commission requires written notification within thirty days of the commencement of operations at this additional location. Operations at the additional location must commence within one calendar year from the date of this action. The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2022-2023.

October 31, 2016

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To include within the scope of the institution's accreditation the relocation of the additional location from Central PA Office of SPS, 750 East Park Drive, Harrisburg, PA 17111-2758 to Eastern University-Central PA, 10 North Second Street, Harrisburg, PA 17101 and to include the new location. The Commission requires written notification within thirty days of the commencement of operations at the new location and the closure of the old location. Operations at the additional location must commence within one calendar year from the date of this action. The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2022-2023.

May 2, 2016

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To approve the relocation of the Center City additional location from 1800 JFK Blvd, Philadelphia, PA 19103 to 1601 Market Street, Philadelphia, PA 19103 and to include the new additional location within the scope of the institution's accreditation. The Commission requires written notification within 30 days of the commencement of operations at this additional location and the closure of the old location. In the event that operations at the additional location do not commence within one calendar year from the approval of this action, approval will lapse. The Periodic Review Report is due June 1, 2018.

January 4, 2016

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To note the institution's decision to close its branch campus at 588 North Gulph Road, King of Prussia, PA 19406 and to approve the teach-out plan. The Commission requires notification within thirty days of the closure of this branch campus. The Periodic Review Report is due June 1, 2018.

November 2, 2015

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To include the additional location at ACTS Retirement - Life Community, Inc., 812 North Bethlehem Pike, Ambler, PA 19002, within the scope of the institution's accreditation. The Commission requires written notification within thirty days of the commencement of operations at this additional location. In the event that operations at the additional location do not commence within one calendar year from the approval of this action, approval will lapse. The Periodic Review Report is due June 1, 2018.

April 27, 2015

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To note the institution's decision to close its additional location at the Consolidated School of Business, 2124 Ambassador Circle, Lancaster, PA 17603. The Commission requires notification within thirty days of the closure of this additional location. The Periodic Review Report is due June 1, 2018.

February 10, 2015

To note the institution's decision not to open the additional location at Eastern University/York, Consolidated School of Business - York, 1605 Clugston Road, York, PA 17404-1779 and to remove the location from the institution's accreditation.

January 5, 2015

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change requests and to include the post-master's certificate in Applied Behavior Analysis and post-master's certificate in Professional Counseling within the scope of the institution's accreditation. The Periodic Review Report is due June 1, 2018.

December 19, 2014

To note the institution decided not to open the additional location at Lankenau Hospital, 100 East Lancaster Avenue, Wynnewood, PA 19096 and to remove the location from the institution's accreditation.

June 26, 2014

To accept the monitoring report and note that a visit will not be conducted. The Periodic Review Report is due June 1, 2018.

March 3, 2014

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To note the institution's decision to close its additional location at Gaudenzia Inc., 106 West Main Street, Norristown, PA 19401 and to approve the teach out plan. The Commission requires written notification within thirty days of the closure of this additional location. To note the monitoring report due March 1 has been received and will be acted on by the Commission in June. The Periodic Review Report is due June 1, 2018.

July 1, 2013

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To include the additional location at Lankenau Hospital, 100 East Lancaster Avenue, Wynnewood, PA 19096 within the scope of the institution's accreditation. The Commission requires written notification within thirty days of the commencement of operations at this additional location. In the event that operations at the additional location do not commence within one calendar year from the approval of this action, approval will lapse. To remind the institution of the monitoring report, due March 1, 2014, providing further evidence that (1) the reprioritization process is linked to planning, decision-making, and resource allocation, and makes use of assessment results; (2) planning, resource allocation, and institutional renewal processes have sufficient simplicity, practicality and ownership to be sustainable; and (3) the Institutional Effectiveness, Renewal and Assessment Report indicators are more clearly linked to the strategic plan (Standards 2 and 7). A small team visit may follow submission of the report. The Periodic Review Report is now due June 1, 2018.

June 27, 2013

To accept the monitoring report and to note the visit by the Commission's representatives. To remove the warning and reaffirm accreditation because the institution is now in compliance with Standard 2 (Planning, Resource Allocation and Institutional Renewal) and Standard 7 (Institutional Assessment). To request a monitoring report, due March 1, 2014, providing further evidence that (1) the reprioritization process is linked to planning, decision-making, and resource allocation, and makes use of assessment results; (2) planning, resource allocation, and institutional renewal processes have sufficient simplicity, practicality and ownership to be sustainable; and (3) the Institutional Effectiveness, Renewal and Assessment Report indicators are more clearly linked to the strategic plan (Standards 2 and 7). A small team visit may follow submission of the report. The Periodic Review Report is now due June 1, 2018.

November 15, 2012

To thank the institution for receiving the Commission's representative and to affirm inclusion of the relocation of Palmer Theological Seminary to 588 N. Gulph Road, King of Prussia, PA 19406 within the scope of the institution's accreditation. To remind the institution that it has been warned that its accreditation may be in jeopardy because of insufficient evidence that the institution is currently in compliance with Standard 2 (Planning, Resource Allocation, and Institutional Renewal) and Standard 7 (Institutional Assessment). To note that the institution remains accredited while on warning. To remind the institution of the monitoring report, due March 1, 2013, documenting that the institution has achieved and can sustain compliance with Standards 2 and 7, including but not limited to the development and implementation of (1) an institutional strategic plan which includes clearly stated institution and unit-level goals and objectives linked to mission and used for planning and resource allocation; (2) planning and improvement processes that are clearly communicated, provide for constituent participation, and incorporate the use of results; (3) an institutional strategic plan that includes the assignment of responsibility for improvements and assurance of accountability (Standard 2); (4) a documented, organized and sustained institutional assessment process with evidence that assessment information is used to improve programs, services, and processes and is shared and discussed with appropriate constituents (Standard 7); and (5) a process to periodically assess the effectiveness of planning, resource allocation, and institutional renewal (Standards 2 and 7). A small team visit will follow submission of the monitoring report. The due date for the next Periodic Review Report will be established when accreditation is reaffirmed.

November 15, 2012

To note the visit by the Commission's representative. To remind the institution that it has been warned that its accreditation may be in jeopardy because of insufficient evidence that the institution is currently in compliance with Standard 2 (Planning, Resource Allocation, and Institutional Renewal) and Standard 7 (Institutional Assessment). To note that the institution remains accredited while on warning. To remind the institution of the monitoring report, due March 1, 2013, documenting that the institution has achieved and can sustain compliance with Standards 2 and 7, including but not limited to the development and implementation of (1) an institutional strategic plan which includes clearly stated institution and unit-level goals and objectives linked to mission and used for planning and resource allocation; (2) planning and improvement processes that are clearly communicated, provide for constituent participation, and incorporate the use of results; (3) an institutional strategic plan that includes the assignment of responsibility for improvements and assurance of accountability (Standard 2); (4) a documented, organized and sustained institutional assessment process with evidence that assessment information is used to improve programs, services, and processes and is shared and discussed with appropriate constituents (Standard 7); and (5) a process to periodically assess the effectiveness of planning, resource allocation, and institutional renewal (Standards 2 and 7). A small team visit will follow submission of the monitoring report. The due date for the next Periodic Review Report will be established when accreditation is reaffirmed.

August 27, 2012

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To note the institution's decision to close the following additional locations and remove the locations from the scope of the institution's accreditation: (1) Hall of States Building, 444 North Capitol Street NW, Suite 422, Washington, DC 20001; and (2) Wyndham Garden Hotel, 45 Industrial Highway, Essington, PA 19029. The Commission requires written notification within thirty days of the closure of these additional locations. To remind the institution that the Commission acted to warn the institution that its accreditation may be in jeopardy because of insufficient evidence that the institution is currently in compliance with Standard 2 (Planning, Resource Allocation, and Institutional Renewal) and Standard 7 (Institutional Assessment). To note that the institution remains accredited while on warning. A monitoring report is due March 1, 2013, documenting that the institution has achieved and can sustain compliance with Standards 2 and 7, including but not limited to the development and implementation of (1) an institutional strategic plan which includes clearly stated institution and unit-level goals and objectives linked to mission and used for planning and resource allocation; (2) planning and improvement processes that are clearly communicated, provide for constituent participation, and incorporate the use of results; (3) an institutional strategic plan that includes the assignment of responsibility for improvements and assurance of accountability (Standard 2); (4) a documented, organized and sustained institutional assessment process with evidence that assessment information is used to improve programs, services, and processes and is shared and discussed with appropriate constituents (Standard 7); and (5) a process to periodically assess the effectiveness of planning, resource allocation, and institutional renewal (Standards 2 and 7). A small team visit will follow submission of the monitoring report. To note that the liaison visit has occurred and will be acted upon at the November Commission meeting. The due date for the next Periodic Review Report will be established when accreditation is reaffirmed.

August 24, 2012

To acknowledge receipt of the required federal approval and to include provisionally the branch campus at the Palmer Theological Seminary, 588 North Gulph Road, King of Prussia, PA, 19406 within the scope of the institution's accreditation pending a site visit to the new branch campus within six months of commencing operations at the site.

July 2, 2012

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request. To note the institution's decision to close the following additional locations and remove the locations from the scope of the institution's accreditation: (1) Mt. Airy Church of God in Christ, 6401 Ogontz Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19126; (2) Pottstown Comfort Inn, Route 100 & Shoemaker Road, Pottstown, PA 19464; and (3) Sharon Baptist Church, 3955 Conshohocken Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19131. The Commission requires written notification within thirty days of the closure of these additional locations. To remind the institution that the Commission acted to warn the institution that its accreditation may be in jeopardy because of insufficient evidence that the institution is currently in compliance with Standard 2 (Planning, Resource Allocation, and Institutional Renewal) and Standard 7 (Institutional Assessment). To note that the institution remains accredited while on warning. A monitoring report is due March 1, 2013, documenting that the institution has achieved and can sustain compliance with Standards 2 and 7, including but not limited to the development and implementation of (1) an institutional strategic plan which includes clearly stated institution and unit-level goals and objectives linked to mission and used for planning and resource allocation; (2) planning and improvement processes that are clearly communicated, provide for constituent participation, and incorporate the use of results; (3) an institutional strategic plan that includes the assignment of responsibility for improvements and assurance of accountability (Standard 2); (4) a documented, organized and sustained institutional assessment process with evidence that assessment information is used to improve programs, services, and processes and is shared and discussed with appropriate constituents (Standard 7); and (5) a process to periodically assess the effectiveness of planning, resource allocation, and institutional renewal (Standards 2 and 7). A small team visit will follow submission of the monitoring report. A prompt liaison guidance visit to discuss the Commission's expectations will be directed. The due date for the next Periodic Review Report will be established when accreditation is reaffirmed.

June 28, 2012

To warn the institution that its accreditation may be in jeopardy because of insufficient evidence that the institution is currently in compliance with Standard 2 (Planning, Resource Allocation, and Institutional Renewal) and Standard 7 (Institutional Assessment). To note that the institution remains accredited while on warning. To request a monitoring report, due March 1, 2013, documenting that the institution has achieved and can sustain compliance with Standards 2 and 7, including but not limited to the development and implementation of (1) an institutional strategic plan which includes clearly stated institution and unit-level goals and objectives linked to mission and used for planning and resource allocation; (2) planning and improvement processes that are clearly communicated, provide for constituent participation, and incorporate the use of results; (3) an institutional strategic plan that includes the assignment of responsibility for improvements and assurance of accountability (Standard 2); (4) a documented, organized and sustained institutional assessment process with evidence that assessment information is used to improve programs, services, and processes and is shared and discussed with appropriate constituents (Standard 7); and (5) a process to periodically assess the effectiveness of planning, resource allocation, and institutional renewal (Standards 2 and 7). A small team visit will follow submission of the monitoring report. To direct a prompt liaison guidance visit to discuss the Commission's expectations. The due date for the next Periodic Review Report will be established when accreditation is reaffirmed.

January 3, 2012

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request and to include provisionally the relocation of the branch campus at the Palmer Theological Seminary from 6 East Lancaster Avenue, Wynnewood, PA 19096 to 588 North Gulph Road, King of Prussia, PA, 19406 within the scope of the institution’s accreditation, effective upon receipt of required state and Federal approvals and pending a site visit to the new branch campus within six months of commencing operations at the site. The Commission requires written notification within thirty days of the commencement of operations at this additional location. In the event that operations at the branch campus do not commence within one calendar year from the approval of this action, approval will lapse. The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2011-2012.

August 30, 2011

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request and to note the institution's decision to close the following additional locations: (1) Eastern University - Harrisburg School District, 2101 North Front Street, Building 2, Harrisburg, PA 17110-1036; (2) Eastern University - Norristown at Dekalb, Mercy Suburban Norristown, 2701 Dekalb Pike, Norristown, PA 19401; (3) Eastern University - West Chester, Chester City Hospital, 701 East Marshall Street, West Chester, PA 19380; (4) Eastern University - Wynnewood, Lankenau Hospital, 100 Lancaster Avenue, Wynnewood, PA 19096; and (5) Hampton Inn Lancaster, 545 Greenfield Road, Lancaster, PA 17601 - 5833. The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2011-2012.

June 28, 2011

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request and to re-classify the additional location at George Washington High School, 10175 Bustleton Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19116-3718 as an instructional site. To note the institution's decision to close the following additional locations and remove the locations from the scope of the institution's accreditation: (1) Eastern University/ Valley Forge, 588 North Gulph Rd., King of Prussia, PA 19406-2831; (2) Eastern University/ Hosanna Christian Fellowship, 29 Green Acre Rd., Lititz, PA 17543-8770; and (3) Eastern University/ Oklahoma, 2299 Old Bacone Rd., Muskogee, OK 74403. The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2011-2012.

June 28, 2011

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request and to include the Certificate of Biblical Studies and the Certificate of Christian Leadership within the scope of the institution's accreditation.

January 3, 2011

To acknowledge receipt of the substantive change request and to include the additional location at Eastern University/York, Consolidated School of Business - York, 1605 Clugston Road, York, PA 17404-1779 within the scope of the institution's accreditation. To further note the institution's decision to close the additional location at Advanced Skills Center, 2101 Pennsylvania Avenue, York, PA 17404-1793 and remove the location from the scope of the institution's accreditation. The next evaluation visit is scheduled for 2011-2012.

Distance Education

Approved to offer programs by this delivery method

Correspondence Education

Not approved for this delivery method

Approved Credential Levels

The following represents credential levels included in the scope of the institution’s accreditation:

Postsecondary award (1-2 years) Included within the scope

Associate's Degree or Equivalent Included within the scope

Bachelor's Degree or Equivalent Included within the scope

Master's Degree or Equivalent Included within the scope

Post-Master's Certificate Included within the scope

Doctor's Degree - Professional Practice Included within the scope

Doctor's Degree- Research/Scholarship Included within the scope
